intro: Rhodamnia waigeoensis, commonly known as the Waigeo rhodamnia, is a flowering plant native to the lowland rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers with white or pale pink petals. It produces woody capsules as fruit, which contain numerous seeds. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
